title: With The Cost Of Beef Up, Pasture Prices Rise, Too
teaser: Grant Gerlock from Harvest Public Media brings us a story about how fewer cattle means a higher price on pastures.
contentencoded:
The U.S. beef herd is smaller than it has been in decades, thanks to drought and low cattle prices. But Midwest ranchers are eager to grow. And that has turned grass into a hot commodity.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Harvest Public Media’s Grant Gerlock has the story.

  • Read more on this story via Harvest Public Media

Reporter

  • Grant Gerlock, reporter for Harvest Public Media, a public radio reporting project that focuses on agriculture and food production issues. He tweets @ggerlock.
